com.b2international.snowowl.core

Interface ServiceProvider

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BranchContext, Repository, RepositoryContext, TransactionContext
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultBranchContext, DelegatingBranchContext, DelegatingRepositoryContext, DelegatingServiceProvider, Environment, ImportOnlySnomedTransactionContext

    public interface ServiceProvider
    Since:
    4.5

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ServiceProvider EMPTY
      Empty ServiceProvider implementation that throws UnsupportedOperationExceptions when trying to provide services.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> com.google.inject.Provider<T> provider(Class<T> type)
      Returns a Provider to provide the given type when needed by using service(Class), so the returned Provider will never return null instances, instead it throws exception, which may indicate application bootstrapping/initialization problems.
      <T> T service(Class<T> type)
      Returns the given service or throws an exception if none found in the current ApplicationContext.

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY

        static final ServiceProvider EMPTY
        Empty ServiceProvider implementation that throws UnsupportedOperationExceptions when trying to provide services. Useful when testing Request implementations.
        Since:
        5.4

    • Method Detail

      • service

        <T> T service(Class<T> type)
        Returns the given service or throws an exception if none found in the current ApplicationContext.
        Parameters:
        type -
        Returns:
        the currently registered service implementation for the given service interface, never null

      • provider

        <T> com.google.inject.Provider<T> provider(Class<T> type)
        Returns a Provider to provide the given type when needed by using service(Class), so the returned Provider will never return null instances, instead it throws exception, which may indicate application bootstrapping/initialization problems.
        Parameters:
        type -
        Returns:
